result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:45 AM Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: K Kittel.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Siyad Abdi Kusow. Atty Harrelson notes he will not be retaining this matter, has spoken with the DE and asks for continuance of the JT due to an overwhelming amount of digital evidence. Court will not remove JT as of yet. Will rest this matter to check status of new Atty. DE may appear by zoom at next hearing if scheduling only, or unless his new Atty would like him present. Court confirms address and phone of DE. Adjourned: 10:50 am
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 11:45 am.

8:04 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Siyad Abdi Kusow appeared by zoom.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Siyad Abdi Kusow.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file. Atty Harrelson is asking for another PTC, believes there will be a resolution. Parties make statements.  Court schedules trial. Counsel to have issues ironed out by next court date. Atty Harrelson asking to modify bond and to appear by zoom for next hearing.  Court modifies bond to eliminate weekly call ins. Next hearing DE to appear in person.  Court is not requiring a new bond to be signed. Clerk to fax minutes to JSC to inform them of modification.  Adjourned at 8:17 AM
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:14 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Siyad Abdi Kusow appeared by video.  Attorney ADA Ericka Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Siyad Abdi Kusow. Court reviews file. Atty Harrelson states there is no resolution at this time, needs a bit more time to go over discovery and requesting to modify bond.  ADA Ellenwood makes statements regarding bond.  Court will schedule one more PTC, at that time parties to know if they will be scheduling a trial or MH.  Court does not modify bond at this time, orders DE to continue weekly contacts with JSC.  If next hearing is scheduling only DE can appear by zoom.  DE verified address.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 10:23 AM. bph

Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Siyad Abdi Kusow appeared via zoom. Case called at 10:21 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for an arraignment. Address confirmed. Atty Harrelson has received a copy of information. Waives further reading. Waives speedy trial.  NG plea to all counts. Reserves on jurisdictional objections. Court advises DE of right to appear in person. DE understands and waives personal appearance. Court will accept waiver of appearance for arraignment only. ADA Becker states discovery was mailed out yesterday. Court schedules. In person appearance. Bond continues in form and amount. Court adjourned at 10:24 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:34 AM   Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: S. Fox, ADA:  Francis D. Collins, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF:  Siyad Abdi Kusow appeared. S/T Inv. Mike O'Keefe. Direct by ADA Collins. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Atty Harrelson makes statements as offer of proof. Atty arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court reserves on motions to dismiss at this time. Court approves Def to appear by zoom.  Arraignment scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Pretrial Assessment Report. SEALED.  gll
Preliminary hearing on January 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.R.I. (DOB 4/10/06) or their residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

No unsupervised contact with any female under the age of 18.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to call the St. Croix County Justice Support Center to verify address and stability ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

02:24 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Melstrom, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA: Bela Alexander Ballo DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson and Kaitlin Dippolito for today  DF:  Siyad Abdi Kusow appeared from jail. Defendant qualifies for PD.  DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument; bond ordered. Court sets Preliminary Hearing with Court Commissioner. Adjourned at 2:34 PM.  gll  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
